result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest McCottry III

records.addlTxt: All conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Kuehn appeared by video. Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant is cancelled. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

Defendant Earnest McCottry III not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing 10-11-2022. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III not in court. Due to an error with the spelling of the defendant's name, Milwaukee County Jail indicated to the courts that the defendant failed to be booked. Subsequently, a warrant was issued on September 28th, 2022. Court ordered the warrant cancelled per the request of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Defendant failed to be booked and released by September 24th, 2022 by 5:00PM. Court took no action as to bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:  Amazon, 9700 S. 13th St., Oak Creek, WI
 or A.C., A.C.B., M.M.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Earnest McCottry III.  Student Intern Lukas Jaeger under the supervision of Attorney  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant called at 1:12pm on 8/25/22 stating he has covid request and adjournment.  The commissioner will adjourn the matter until 9/22/22 at 2:00pm
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/24/22 @ 2p
